description:
Position Summary:

The Sponsorship Support Manager is a vital member of the growing sponsorship team. This person is responsible for supporting sponsorship sales, coordinating and executing contracted sponsor benefits and acting as the day-to-day point of contact for many of our partners underwriting our US Conferences and Center programs. The Sponsorship Support Manager must be a proactive multi-tasker with excellent communication skills. Because the Sponsorship Support Manager will be client-facing, extreme attention to detail and superb customer services skills are an absolute must.

Responsibilities:
• Ensure contracted sponsorship benefits are properly executed. This includes but is not limited to:
• Confirming proper logo inclusion/placement on materials
• Facilitating invitations and attendee follow up to sponsored events
• Preparing and sending sponsorship information packets
• Sending and following up on invoices, collecting credit card information for outstanding cases
• Registering event guests
• Delivering post-event benefits including feedback and opt-in data
• Preparing sponsor debrief reports
• Invoicing sponsors and tracking/collecting accounts receivables
• Manage sponsor participation in virtual events and webcasts
• Serving as key liaison between sponsor and production team in scheduling, marketing, and executing successful online events
• Collecting sponsor brand and multimedia content assets to build sponsor booths and target pages
• Delivering post-event digital assets and analytics
• Identifying innovative practices and creating new ways to optimize sponsor participation in virtual events and webcasts
• Assist in activities related to selling sponsorship including:
• Manage and curate participant lists
• Inputting data for new sales (Sugar CRM)
• Releasing internal sales notifications
• The Sponsorship Support Manager will also be responsible for working with the following internal teams to ensure proper and timely coordination of sponsor development and involvement:
• Sponsorship
• Centers (CED, ESF, ESG, HC, M&C)
• Accounting/ Accounts Receivable
• Meeting Planning
• Marketing/Audience Development
• Programming, Digital Media

Qualifications:
• Bachelor's degree required
• Minimum 3-5 years of sponsorship fulfillment or other relevant account management experience
• Strong organizational, interpersonal and communication skills required
• Ability to handle multiple projects at once
• CRM Experience
• Strong sense of customer service
• Experience in virtual events or webcasts preferred
